definition[0]: too bad to be corrected, repaired, or saved
definition[1]: irredeemable bonds pay interest to the person who is lending money but do not have a set date saying when the money being lent must be paid back
definition[2]: an irredeemable bond pays interest but has no MATURITY DATE (=date at which the borrower will repay the lender)
example[1]: There are nine British government stocks outstanding which have no final maturity; they are irredeemable bonds.
